tool.name: palom
tool.description: Piecewise alignment for layers of mosaics. A tool for registering whole-slide images with different IHC stainings
tool.command:
ln -s "$reference_image" ./ref.svs &&
ln -s "$channels" ./channels.csv &&
#for $i in $moving_images: ln -s "$i" "${i.name}" && #end for
python "$script"

configfiles.configfile:
import os import pathlib import pandas as pd import palom from palom.cli.svs import run_palom
cwd = os.getcwd()
ref_img = pathlib.Path(os.path.join(cwd,"ref.svs"))
images = [ref_img] channels = ["hematoxylin"] modes = ["hematoxylin"]
#for $i in $moving_images: img = pathlib.Path("${i.name}") images.append(img) #end for
channel_df = pd.read_csv(os.path.join(cwd, "channels.csv")) channel_df = channel_df.astype({'channel':'string'}) channels += list(channel_df['channel']) modes += list(channel_df['mode'])
pixel_size = None
#if $pixel_size: pixel_size = float($pixel_size) #end if
level = 0
#if $level: level = int($level) #end if
output_path = pathlib.Path(os.path.join(cwd, "registered.ome.tiff"))
qc_path = output_path.parent / 'qc'
os.mkdir(qc_path)
run_palom( img_paths = images, img_modes = modes, pixel_size = pixel_size, channel_names = channels, output_path = output_path, qc_path = qc_path, level = level )

param.name: moving_images
param.label: Moving Images (data collection)
param.help: A collection of svs-format images to align to the reference image

param.name: channels
param.label: Channel and mode dataframe
param.help: A CSV file with 'channel' and 'mode' columns, with a row corresponding to each moving image

param.name: pixel_size
param.label: Pixel Size
param.help: defaults to px size of reference image
